reviewText:
SImplified Version:

No. This kind of free to play game is designed to take your money.

Detailed Version:

First of all, in order to obtain decent troops, you basically have to use in-game currency (gems) to purchase chests. These chests are similarly to packs in trading card games. It is hightly likely that epic and legendary troops will cost you a lots of cash to obtain. However, obtaining the troops is just a start. In order to play even against A.I. you need to level up troops using souls. In story mode, the A.I. has troops of level 10 and up. In order to level up one single troop to level 10, you need to collect around 800 souls.  Each battle will give you 8 souls without buff, hence in order to f2p you need to win at least 400 games. The fastest way to gain souls is disenchanting extra troops as you can imagine. The problem is that in order to play the game you need to use in-game gold to start a game. For instance if you play in story mode, 80 gold will be paid; if you manage to win, 30 to 40 gold will be rewarded. In generally, you need to wait the daily reward gold in order to f2p. It is true that PVP will give you more reward, but it is likely that you will lose without decent troops.

The game is indeed fun, but ruined by microtransactions.

reviewText:
Fun, addictive game. It's not without its flaws, of course. No game is.

For this one, the computer AI cheats like crazy. Seriously. Don't have to take my word for it, it's free to play, see for yourself. But it's typical of all Puzzle Quest games. So if you've played one, you know what to expect.

The guild functions are very basic to the point of just being window dressing. But with the task donations, trophy system and reward tree it does have potential if the devs take the guild system seriously.

It does have a lot of content, interesting storylines, wide variety of enemies and troops, in a massive game world. All free to play, with a cash shop that can be ignored without any content hidden behind pay walls. So for these points alone it gets my thumb's up.

reviewText:
My honest opinion(V2 edited after more play time):

The game plays very well, reading a few reviews set me on edge about the required pay to proceed factor.
Needless to say I finally received a single free key which allowed me to open my first chest! I have learnt since then that Rare cards can sometimes be better used than epic cards! It all comes down to deck dynamics.

There are very varied skills which allow one to customize their decks to their own play style which I consider a big plus.

Now for a bit on the down side, after a few hours of playing without a single new card i decided to sponsor them $5, so yes it has already become a pay to proceed game for me. I received very very nice cards in those packs and as mentioned I dont even use the upper tier cards (I am top tier ranking number 1 as I type this) so if you do happen to get a hold of even some other card options you are not limited by encountering uber god cards that will insta kill your entire team on turn 1!

I did notice I only started finding keys after I purchased a $5 bundle, this may just be random luck but 0 keys for the first 4 hours and 4 keys for the following 2 hours post paying $5.

The normal keys gave me an epic card (Which from what Ive seen is the highest rarity that may be obtained. Thus even free to play has access to this tier.)
the game.
Final note / tip, using a unit that can add orbs to the board, allows for many multi matches giving you gold each time. Using one of these characters almost guarantees that I actually make a bit of gold per win, so spend 60 per match gain 72 back etc.

All in all I  am enjoying the game, it seems the $5 was a good investment for me, however if it turns out that one cannot get keys frequently without paying I would be very very disappointed with this game. All round Im enjoying it, I would recommended to the developers to give one or two low level boosters to give players a head start.

(V2) (Only read this if you need more insight and have been playing a bit) After a considerably longer period of play, it seems key drops are very rare, daily one can expect to accumulate a passive 1000 gold  +-500 from your castle and the rest from login/rank bonuses.
Only 1 castle purchased and used as your home base will accumulate gold for you per day. However normal quest progression that adds a daily +5 gold per day will accumulate daily on castles that are not set as your home base.

Questing generally always costs you gold and you dont make a profit on these, however defences and invasions (Invade button) if you win them frequently always more than double the cost of the match at higher levels. Thus running these can fund your normal questing indefinately.

Once one reaches the top tier ranking you can no longer lose that rank ( As mentioned in game ) This will give you  a considerable amount of free gold and feathers for stuff in the shop every new day.

For me persoanlly I use a mixture of cards that use all the types of energy, this allows for any match to work out well for me. For instance to have 3 cards that all use brown would mean that random matches of other colours would not go to good use and further if you needed to use your 3rd brown allies skill you would first need to fully charge brown allies number 1 and 2!

I like to use at least 1 ally with some sort of random spread damage, this allows for enemies with just 1 or 2 HP remaining to get sniped and the rest of the spread damage not to go to waste as it is allocated to other enemies.

I do hope this tiny" review has helped you a bit. Kind regards :]"

reviewText:
EDIT:  Couple more days of play and I've lost a few matches.  Some of the incredible bad luck streaks have had me threatening to ragequit.  Still enjoying it though.  I find I'm not having any problems with gold--my attention span or my available free are always used up first.

Despite some of the complaints here, you can progress in this game for free.  New allies and fast progression are available for a fee, but if you want a casual, hour-a-day game you can play while you're cooking dinner or watching TV, this is perfect.  As well, I don't think the computer is cheating.  Sure, you'll get nailed by combos that seem unlikely, but you'll land a few of these too and pull victories from almost certain defeats.  Because random.

It's got the weird writing you remember from the Puzzle Quest games, plus the surprisingly deep and addictive gameplay.  Possibly it will become frustratingly difficult later in order to squeeze some money out of me, but for now it's fun.  Nearing the end of the second campaign and haven't lost a battle.

IMO, GoW does the free to play model well.  Give it a try!

reviewText:
When the AI opponents perform a 'mana surge', they are given an extra turn for doing so. However, when the player does the same the player gains no extra turn. This has happened every time I've gotten a 'mana surge'. I'm hoping it is a glitch, because if this is working as intended then the devs of this game gave the AI an unfair advantage over players.

It costs 50 or more gold to play each match, with some quests taking two or more matches to complete. The game starts you with 800 gold and then you earn about 25 gold per a quest and about 9 gold a match. This generally means you're earning less than 50% of the gold you spend to play the matches required to finish a quest. Your kingdom earns you 500 free gold a day, but beyond that you must purchase gold to play. The game PUNISHES players who want to play. You have been warned. You can gain more kingdoms which increase the amount of gold you gain each day, but they cost 350 gold. GG.
voteText: 8 of 16 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Puzzle Quest clone with a nice story but poor programming.

In porting from mobile to PC, I'm guessing some steps were skipped.  On my computer, the graphics appear to be tied directly to the CPU.  So when I play the game, four of my eight cores immediately jump to 100% until they overheat and shut down my computer.

I did some testing:

- If the game is in the background, the graphics stop working and the cores return to normal levels.
- If you watch the resource monitors, the cores remain at 100% whether you are playing a puzzle or navigating the menus.
- If you change screen resolutions, the game continues to tax the cores at 100%.

I believe this means that if the game uses your graphics card at all, it's in the most minimal way possible and all of the resource management is done solely through the CPU.  In addition, the most cores you can have running this thing is four -- so if you have an eight-core processor (like I do), the extra four just sit there.  There appears to be no way to change this.

So, the most I can tell you is that, in my opinion, it's stunningly similar to Puzzle Quest with some nice gameplay changes, but is so poorly optimized that it's not worth bothering with.

reviewText:
From a first start this game certainly has my attention. It's halfway between Marvel Puzzle Quest and Puzzle Quest. It's certainly a clear free-to-play, with many tropes of the genre (an energy-esque currency system that you gain slowly over time, various troops to collect with various power levels, and the ability to pay real world money to get more energy and troops quickly).

It's also certainly well made and interestingly designed, and there are certainly clear benefits to playing well and penalties for playing poorly. If you are playing well, you should be able to bounce around between the different quests and challenges in the different towns you can unlock and find plenty of level-appropriate battles to win. If you are playing poorly, you may find yourself run out of the energy currency pretty quickly.

If you are completely new to the world of match 3, this is not the most forgiving game to figure it out with; if you have been matching jewels for quite a while, this plays well and has some interesting strategies and decisions to make, In any case, it's a game to be enjoyed in short daily sessions rather than a single long weekend.

reviewText:
For starters I'm a huge Puzzle Quest fan and so it's natural that I would try Gems Of War. And this game is sort of a cross between Puzzle Kindgoms and Puzzle Quest as you have a group which benefits from different gems. So you have to think about what troops you bring with you into battle.
Pros : Game is free to play so if you don't like it there is really nothing for you to lose.
Art and music gives it a nice feel
For those that have played Bejewelled and other gem matching games it's pretty simple gameplay.
Lots of depth to the game doesn't get boring.

Cons : Battles get pretty difficult so you may hit a wall around 4 hours into the game where the opposing stack is seemingly unbeatable. You may not like updates on your Facebook page. Guilds are expensive to create and you might have trouble joining one as when I looked they seemed all full. I couldn't figure out how to edit my stack once I created one so I was stuck with an archer unit that was easy fodder for my enemy stack.

Conclusion : I played the game for over 4 hours and I have played a lot of Puzzle Quest there is enough here for fans of the series to make it worthwhile giving this game a go.

reviewText:
This games is REALLY fun.

First, if you are a newbie and you are learning you can play 10-15  matches a day what is a lot of time playing.

If you KNOW HOW to play, you look for troops (http://gemsofwar.com/game-guide-troop-list/) what they do in diferent levels and you use proper ones, you can have unlimited games, not only playing quests... challenges give a lot of gold, also invading others kingdoms...

Use your souls properly, use some strategy (this game is about that) and have fun.

CONS: cant trade cards, i have to buy keys because their drop is really low.
PROS: Fun, free, strategy based game.

Un saludo

reviewText: I like match 3s and this has one of the better combat system.  The gems are color blind friendly, and there is a good degree of freedom to customise your team.  It is a free to play with an energy sytem in the form of gold, so if you want to play more than 45 min a pop and unlock new packs of cards at a quick rate be prepared to pay.  I have not  tried too much pvp, but I can imagene that if you wanted to get up high in the ranks it will cost you some real world money.  I can forsee hitting a wall where it could stop being fun once I have completed the story quests and their challanges, since they are not repetable, but until then it should be some good old match 3 fun,\n\nEdit:  Tried PVP, and I have not ran into any limitations by my not playing money.  Playing PVP you get more gold than you spend per round, so you could play till your eyes bled without having to worry about running out of gold.  The Devs plan weekly or by weekly events to keep things fresh, so I do not think I will run out of content any time soon.

reviewText:
The game is fun to play until you come to the boss monster. There you can clearly see how the game handles difficulty: setting up gems for the opponent, leaving you with just the scraps of gems that you don't need at all.

People saying that it's P2W are absolutely right. There's not a single thing that you can't buy with real cash and it's absolutely necessary to do so unless you're fond of farming the same challenges over and over again in order to get powerful enough to progress further in the game.

I don't recommend the game unless you have patience, you're a masochist or you have a full wallet that needs emptying. If the reason you play the game is the later, the money would be better spent on buying your friends couple of games from their wishlists.

reviewText: The ai is smart decent to the point that you would think its cheating and the game is designed in a way that you dont have to pay for things and at a certain point you can just make free gems without paying for anything out of pocket. if you build a team for grinding money on certain challenges you can double what you put in as far as gold goes. this game has 3 types of currency souls, gems and gold. souls make your troops stronger and gold lets you unlock places therby increasing your gold per minute and then there are gems that you can spend in the store. i guess if you count it there is also glory but not many people play that long to get it. looking at the other reviews its clear no one get through the easy tutorial. this is not first off a match three game this is a puzzle stratagy game and for those who dont know whaty that means then this game is not for you. this game will challenge you in ways that you cant even immagine. there will come a point when you can gerate souls and money easily but if you dont put in the work your not going to get to that point in this game. the site gemsofwar.com will give you plenty of info on troops and weapons that you can aim for to better your team so ya i would reccomend ppl give this game a shot and not judge it till they have unlocked all the kingdoms
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
At first I posted a negative review of this game. There is little to like at first glance. An overly simple to learn game that seems too hard. The thing that brought me back to change my review is that I just kept playing it, rage quit, come back to it and the deeper I went the deeper the rabbit hole took me.

A complex, thrilling and rewarding game that gets better the more you play it. There are a few things that I notice that will really help new players out.

1. Finding a team is hard. Finding a winning team is really hard, this game doesn't pull punches like Marvel Puzzle Quest. After playing this game I haven't opened MPQ since. There is far deeper mechanics to this than just getting all colours of mana covered.

2. The road is long, especially if you are free to play. I spent $20 (which is easily a fair investment for this calibre game) and it got me over that first hurdle of finding a team that works. Ive easily spent far more than that on big title games that have sat on my shelf. Do yourself a favour, pick up some magic keys and all of a sudden this game starts unfolding before you. Additionally they are constantly updating and releasing whole new content and once you start winning games the rewards are regular.

All in all an excellent game. Don't listen to all those peeps ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ in your ear, it will fill up many an hour with eaze.
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Hearthstone + Puzzle Quest = Gems of War

The concept in itself is great and makes for a fun, tactical 'match three' puzzle game. Though 'tact' will only get you so far because as with most of these games that revolve around combat, one luckstreak from the enemy can totally turn the tide of battle. Likewise, it could also be in your favor, but from my experience it usually isn't. I always love a good M3 game especially if there's PvP / Guilds / an online community involved. It's somewhat reminiscent of Marvel Puzzle Quest but I would have to say it's better because of the hearthstone elements, and I just like the fantasy theme much better.

However..! ..as much as I would love to praise this game, there are some great concerns with it. It's free-to-play which in the case of this game has a more negative impact than a positive one in my opinion. I was able to play Marvel PQ competitively with only spending a trivial amount of money for comic slots.. I'm sure this game follows a similar progression but it will require lots of patience and time as the game utilizes a 'sort of stamina system' which uses the in-game currency you otherwise need to progress.

Furthermore.. you can buy keys for the in-game currency to unlock chests (which is basically the same as buying boosters in HS) but if you were to spend real money, you can buy magic" keys which have a much higher chance of netting you a rare or higher card. I got an ultra rare and two rares from 1 magic key
date: 2 more ultras and a rare from 2 more keys (you get 3 cards per key/chest). This unfortunately leads me to believe it is a Pay2Win game which is a real shame.\n\nThis game would have been great as a normal retail game.. or without the obvious P2W elements. Because aside from that
recommended: it's a really fun match three puzzle game. But.. If you have the patience or just don't care about playing it competitively
hoursPlayed:
it's a great way to kill time on a day-to-day basis or once in a while. After all.. it IS free to play.

=== June 2015 Update ===

Instead of rewriting
voteText: I'm adding a little bit to this 'review' so one can consider what I've written previously was my first impression. I just want to clear things up a bit as I do think the game is deserving of it with the amount of updates they have been releasing and whatnot.\n\nI take back what I said about this game being Pay2Win. Spending diamonds/real money basically just speeds up 'progress' if you will
helpfulPercent: but there's no exclusive benefits in comparison to playing normally. Given enough time or with a bit of luck
votesHelpful: everything can be obtained without spending a dime. Once you get a good enough team going
votesTotal: you can easily gain much more gold than what you are spending and you can keep this up endlessly if you so desire. Joining a decent guild can also help a lot with pretty much everything.\n\nThe game is actually pretty solid for what it is. Honestly
votesFunny: the only thing that bothers me and what may have influenced my 'sceptical' thoughts previously is that the pacing of the game is very slow for a 'Match 3' game. I'm not referring to the time you may need to get into it.. it's the actual speed of matching gems that is slow and gets really bothersome. Especially when you make a mistake and/or your opponent is on a huge streak (through luck or otherwise) the slowness of it feels very taunting and unnecessary as you're basically forced to just 'sit and watch' all of it. You can argue that this gives you time to see his moves and keep an overview of the board
commentsCount: but in reality it is pointless.\n\nIn the beginning the AI is very easy but eventually hits a 'stable level' where it will always prioritize extra turns and doesn't miss a single one unless it's obtained through a combo. Paired up with a good team or luck
column16:
enemy turns will feel endless and demoralizing because of the slowness and the breaks between every single match. Disregarding any thoughts of 'artificial luck' this is what broke the game for me and at times made it feel unfair.

TL;DR

If you can get over the slowness and time investment
column17: you shouldn't have much (if any) problems with the game. At it's core
column18: it's a casual game and for that matter it's a pretty good one."

reviewText: Way too luck based
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is Bejeweled where you're against an AI who will destroy you. all the time. most of this game is luck, not even in a good way. I've had so many times where there are 2 moves i can do: put their gun in my mouth so they cant miss, or stand still. Either I set my opponent up to easily hit me, or I waste my turn matching 3 gems I don't need. Then the AI goes, and because of your last move, they get an extra turn, then another, and another, and another...and their troops are all ready to kill yours.

This game does have -some- form of skill involved and feels like you can control whether or not you win, but no. the gems off screen fall in to help the AI more than they will help you.

I would only recommend if you are really into Bejeweled (also theres an odd Hearthstone feel to the game, such as the ranking system). Or maybe you just like losing. Yeah. Play this game if you like losing to AI.

reviewText:
The most fun I've had with a puzzle game in a while. I appreciate games that make you think before you act and this one makes your brain tickle.

There is a lot of stink about ''paying for every little thing'' but honestly, it's not a game where you're supposed to sit for 8 hours and do nothing else with your time. For every moment you are logged out the game GIVES you money. Think of it as a take a break" feature.

You have to pay gold to start a match
recommended:
but I really consider it a 'wager' as you get some or more of that money back if you win.

You CAN get everything in the game without paying a dime. If you spend a single dollar on this game you are weighing your time against money and that's hard for some people.

The PvP aspect is not a true peer to peer deal
hoursPlayed: it finds an opponent around your skill level and puts you against their 4 card deck controlled by the computer. If you win
voteText: you get a great deal of gold (which increases as you rank up [down?]) and daily 'Glory' to trade for items that you cannot pay real money for.\n\nIf the game seems too hard
helpfulPercent: consider changing your lineup or
votesHelpful: God forbid
votesTotal: THINK before you take your turn. You are not penalized for taking your time.\n\nI really enjoy the artwork
votesFunny: they have very talented artists. The flavor text however on  the cards is sometimes a little dry
commentsCount: even for pop culture.  This was the only downside I could find to the whole thing.\n\nThat said
column16: for what it is
column17: and with many run on sentances
column18: I give this game a 4/5. If you need something to do while your friends go out for dinner/school/karate or if you're just alone and bored
column19: I'd highly reccomend at least giving it a try."

reviewText:
Pros:
-Great variety of cards
-really nice artwork
-nice overall mechanics

Cons:
-the devs instead of balancing the cards make some op (very rare cards,which you can get if you are extremely lucky or buy keys out of the game....with real money...) and some cards,which you get from gameplay - very lame.
-really easy to rage quit and rage out on a fight, because the opponent either bought an OP weapon with real money or just had so much souls (which if you don't have time to enter fights,you can buy with money) with which they upgraded to the max 4 legendary cards...
-really interesting that you can see so many people on low levels that have 4 legendary cards (you have 4 card slots and legendary cards less than 1 percent chance to pop up from a key) and also very interesting fact how easily people can exploit bugs in the game


Overall:
I'm giving a good review only because I had very good memories with the game in the beginning,you know, when the devs didn't get money hungry as ♥♥♥♥ and the game had some balance. If you want to try it out go ahead you will have fun moments,but as of now I just refuse to rage out on pvp in which people can buy the win.

reviewText:
Bejeweled and Magic: The Gathering met and had a night of hot passion. Bejeweled, the mother that she is, taught her child that puzzles will last forever. Magic taught his child that having some good friends to support you is a must in any battle. The child grew up to become Gems of War.

An excellent time waster, while still having enough tactical thinking and interaction to remain fun well past when other time wasters get boring.

Try it. It's free, so, you've got nothing to lose.

reviewText: I picked up Gems of War last week and have quite enjoyed it. In particular, I am a fan of puzzle-based combat system and I love that it works cross-platform and that I can play on both iOS and Steam. The combat system in Gems of War is very similar to the Puzzlequest RPG, however, since you quest with a party of four creatures there is a lot more customization involved. In particular, when I get stuck on a hard fight, I love the strategy of trying to figure out what party composition I could pick to win that particular fight.\n\nMany other reviews have touched on the business model. In my opinion, this should not be viewed as a Free to Play" game. Instead
date: it should be viewed as an indie-game with a free demo. Personally
recommended: I enjoyed playing the first part of the game for free
voteText: I spent $20 for in-game currency (gems). I then purchased the biggest chunk of gold that I could
helpfulPercent: and spent the little bit that I had left over on a couple of "keys". This has worked very well for me.\n\nWith my $20 purchase (used almost entirely for gold) I have been able to play the game as much as I want to. Keys drop randomly in-game and so I feel that between quest rewards (for completing a storyline) and random drop keys that I have been able to acquire new allies at an acceptable rate. I am very happy with the entertainment value that I have gotten for my money
votesHelpful: and I think this game is easily as good as other $20-independent games on Steam.\n\nOne last tip -- it wasn't obvious to me at first
votesTotal: but "Challenges" are the best missions to run to level-up your allies. Run the same challenge repeatedly and each victory provides more of the level-up resource ("souls") for your party. The story-driven "Quest" missions are a lot of fun
votesFunny: and each plot arc yields a cool new ally
commentsCount: so when you have leveled-up on the "Challenge" missions you can use your powerful team to advance in the "Quest" missions. Alternating between "Challenges" and "Quest" yields a very satisfying progression."

reviewText:
Difficult to explain this one.

Each match you play costs gold. If you win you earn approx. double the gold. If you lose you lose your gold.

Starting out your at an EXTREME disadvantage because none of your stuff is leveled up and everyone else seems to have max leveled cards. On top of that, your not playing against other players.....your playing against the AI.

So please consider this.....a game who marketing is based on the player needing gold to pay for matches, or players in need of leveling up so they can actually compete. Do you really think the AI isnt going to cheat to get you to lose money?

I write this after just having a match where I had all 4 of my cards near max armor/health. The AI had one card left, poisoned and 4 armor and 1 hp. Through some strange twist of fate, the AI managed to luckly" garner 14 extra turns which was enough to defeat me.

The devs will tell you this cannot happen and that the code is not set to do this. They are liars.

It's a fun enough game to play the single player quests I suppose. But for your sake
date:
do not give these people your money.



EDIT 5/7/2016

So at the behest of a member of the Dev team I decided to try this game again. It took them

three days to find my old account and get it working. Some of the features of the game are

improved. Again
voteText: nothing different there. More importantly
helpfulPercent: the\n\nAI is still horrible
votesHelpful:
and quite possibly worse. It will and does change the gem drops to it's own

advantage. Matches you should never lose will result in the AI 'CHEATING' and costing you a

win.

Bottom line
votesTotal: there is nothing in this game you cant get with some play time.\n\nDO NOT GIVE THESE PEOPLE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!"

reviewText:
First off, I love this game. Perfect mix of Match-3 and Collectible Card Game.

I am wondering about some of the comments I read though...

I agree that the new ranking system is no help to most players, but it does not remove any fun from the rest of the game. Apart from that, the new PvP system is otherwise much better than before.

You must now use 1 diamond to get new opponents instead of 10 gold. Honestly, since you now get 3 choices for each match instead of only 1, I never had to use that. At worst, I select the Easy" opponent which I know I will beat and just get lower rewards for that fight.

As in any other game
date: those who play more will have an advantage. That is what the ranking system gives. And for most players
recommended: the only reason to try to reach high ranks is pride
hoursPlayed: not the prices. What I think is missing would be giving all players who reach Tier 1 a couple(1-2) of the week's Traitstones. That would reward everyone who makes the effort of getting to Tier 1 and would help players progress.\n\nI totally disagree that the system is now "Pay-to-stay" or "Pay-to-win". I would rather call it "Pay to speed things up". Even without paying
voteText: this game is still very enjoyable. If fact
helpfulPercent: even more so with 2.0 for me.\n\nAnyway
votesHelpful: I'll keep playing. This much free fun is not to be missed.\n"

reviewText:
this is a match 3/card game the colours you play away are used to fill the mana bar of your troops for additional attack possibilities and thats where the deck building comes in victories give you more gold and possible a reward

i had somewhat of a love/hate relationship with this game the first 100 hours not knowing some things that would greatly improve the gold i could have to play with (i spend my gems on keys while i should have bought a costume first and i never joined a guild in the start and thats where you can get more items and mana advantages to use)

i see many reviews saying this is a pay to win game i would have to disagree aldow starting this game for the first time and going to play pvp wil most likely make you ragequit and give you this idea there are many kingdoms that you need to unlock and play the challenges and quests in to get rewards these rewards you need to start making a deck that can compete in pvp

there is also a arena mode where you and your opponent bolth play on the same level this cost more gold to enter but wil give you more rewards that you can use to further build your deck i would advice to use this as a beginner

over time there have been many improvements to balance things better and also now and then we get a new kingdom with new quests and challenges

gold = used to enter any game. unlocking kingdoms wil raise the gold you get per day, a win always pays gold, gold can also buy iron key that give you 3 troops (magic keys give better troops)

gems = used to buy magic keys or costumes (keys unlock 3 troops could be doubles tho and gems buy you a costume that for example gives you more gold per win or more souls or bolth

souls = used to upgrade your troops you can upgrade them 15 times untill maxed

glory = used to buy new stuff from the store stuff like weapons and troops new stuff is added on a regular basis you can win more glory by playing pvp

now the whole game is build around microtransactions however you dont have to use it, it wil only make you progress faster not better if you dont want to pay there is plenty to do just be smart about it

pvp = semi pvp you are not actualy playing live agains a person instead agains a person's build deck

the team behind this already helped me 2 times on a problem i had first time a challenge did not unlock and a second time they recovered my old save file that i forgot to backup before my pc reinstall big plus on that

seeing the things that have been added in the last 6 months i give this game 8/10

reviewText:
It takes a while to get off the ground, but the game truly can be free to play. I've unlocked all the kingdoms and gotten up to rank 4 with a solid team of units, all without paying anything. I'm likely to make a small purchase for some vanity stuff just to support the game, but it really isn't necessary.
If you liked puzzle quest, this game is in a very similar vein, and virtually the same.


That said, the strategy and options are much deeper, and although it can be played casually, there's some pretty neat combos in there for those who like to think about their choices.

Update:
With a bunch more hours sunk into this game, it's still quite entertaining.
The developers are continuing to improve on it, and have added a number of features that increase options for play.

I'm still playing for free, but will likely pay money into it to support the developers.
One important aspect is finding a good guild to play with. Even the conveniences normally only available for paid players can be earned in time.

reviewText:
TL;DR version: Hesitant yes, if you're an intelligent player that paces their games.  A no if you're a one-sitting gorger.

As far as a game goes, I find it a nice and interesting take on the Puzzle Quest concept.  The art is clean, the mechanics are smooth, and things are for the most part labeled as they should.  It's still a question of how much mana of a color you need for a certain card, but considering it's fairly recently come out it's not that big of a gripe though.

In regards to the reviews of Getting stuck after 4 hours" because of coins and souls
date: I have to say this:  There's more to this game than the storyline.\n\nIn regards to coins: Yes
hoursPlayed: and battles do cost 50-60 coins apiece
voteText: but this is to try to help you limit your playtime.  You're not supposed to gorge on video games for 12+ hours at a time.  The game does seem to be formatted like a mobile game
helpfulPercent: and one of the logos on the title splash IS a mobile department.  So the micropayments for additional playtime/content seems normal
votesHelpful: yet I haven't spent a dime on the game and am having fun.\n\nIn regards to souls: Don't hoard cards.  Look through what you have

votesFunny: also do Challenges.  Broken Spire's Stone Wall and Fortress Siege can be done really easy with a lot of cheese tactics
commentsCount: and they give large amounts of souls for completing them.  So it'd be a win-win

reviewText:
I dont write many reviews but the extrem bias towards the negative side of this game astonishes me.

A few key points I want to make clear (at least how I see them)

1. You have to pay to plays
It is correct to a certain extend, especially in the beginning. But after a day of gold generation you will have enough gold to play casualy 1-3 hours per day.

2. It's a P2W game
Yes.. to the certain extend it is. If you dont spend any money you will have a hard time playing in the top pvp ranks after the leaderboard system will go on. I spend a rather hefty amount in card packs to build a tier1 competitive deck and it is stronger than most of the ones of my opponents.
You will have to play for a long time to make a deck with more than 1 legendary and only a few of them are acutally very good.
If you are not interested in PVP the P2W impact is much lower if even there.

3. The AI Cheats
No.
Just no.
The devs explained the mechanic behind the AI in this topic:
http://gemsofwar.com/forums/topic/cascades-and-shuffles/

And as a player who spends rather long per turn thinking about the possible different outcome with each match and the cascade resulting from it, there is no bias towards the AI.

If you are a bad player you will loose often and hard. If you are a good player you will win much more than you loose due to an unlucky break.

reviewText:
Definitely recommended if you like puzzle quest and fun rpg elements.

The storyline is.. strange. I often feel that I'm the bad guy and I do hope that was their intention, elseway this game has lots and lots of irony.

It's still expanding and slowly balancing. Everyone plays for themselves, but at the same time you unlock various rewards with your guild if you want to.

I lost my account once, but the staff is very friendly and helpful and I could continue playing in no-time.
Nothing but kudos from me to them!

The AI always uses perfect moves. And they should because they can't plan one step ahead like we can. It's a strange but perfect balance.
Can't cope with fairness? then don't play this game ;)

Storyline 5/10
Fun 10/10
RPG elements 9/10
Promising to get even better over time 10/10
Addictiveness.. 8/10

reviewText:
New Review :
After playing this game for a while, I think it's quite good for a clone of Puzzle Quest, using the troops as a variation & hero's equipment that changes all the time and use different kind of gems for each weapon, I give this game a thumbs up.

reviewText:
I played this game when it was first released and enjoyed it and would recommend it to everyone. I took a break after completing all the quests and getting rank 1 in pvp every week. I recently reinstalled the game and have found that the game is no longer fun to play.

- Chests have been changed to prevent players from getting creatures as quickly, now chests only give weak creatures or low amounts of easy to collect resources unless your willing to pay for them or grind for glory or gems.

- Traits... This system is terrible, it buffs already powerful creatures and creates a huge divide between strong and weak creatures.

- Traitstones are used to give your creatures traits. They are aquired randomly and slowly, but you must have many of them of a specific type and quality to actually use them. You will spend more of your time trying to get traitstones than actually playing if you want a strong team.

- P2W... The game used to be fair for all, now with traits and the new chest system along with the new VIP system. Paying players will always be far stronger than free players.

This game that I used to enjoy has become a massive grind and pay to win.

reviewText:
I like this game for what it is. I hit the paywall (ran out of the coins you need to continue playing) after 8 hours of playtime. Playing PVP rewards coins. You can significantly extend your play time by balancing the PVP and PVE that you do. However, it only takes a few unlucky turns to suddenly find yourself out of coins.

The game steals a lot of design elements from Hearthstone, the loading screen, the disenchant system, the cards, and a lot more. These make the game feel really cheap. But the game is really cheap.

I don't regret downloading this game, and certainly got more than $0.00 worth of entertainment out of it.

reviewText:
Alright, here it goes. I have played Gems of War for roughly 483 hours. I started the game with the expecation to find a experience that is relaxing, which this game is - it's relaxing.

I will focus on what I find good and bad about the game and answer to a few points I've noticed in other reviews.


The good:
The game looks awesome (ingame art looks really great, gems look good too)
It's free (I've tried out different games of the same genre, this is by far my favorite and it is free)
Has great replay value (collecting different weapons, armors, creatures adds different layers to gameplay. Different creature combos, home kingdom, weapons etc play out differently.)
Constantly updated (I've played the game roughly from november of 2014, within that time there have been multiple updates, adding creatures, features, weapons etc)
Great customer service by the company who produced the game (they answer fast and solve the problem, if you have one.)
The bad:
The only problem with this game I have encountered is account information storage. Namely when I bought a new PC and logged on to my steam account and launched the game, my account was gone. I emailed customer support, as it appears the account information is partially stored on your computer (they had a copy of it though). They sent me the needed files, told me where to place them and did that within 24 hours. So all in all, while annoying, the problem was solved quickly and well.
Misconceptions about this game I have read in other reviews:
It's pay to win."
If you pay
date: you get the chance to get ingame items (such as souls which are used to ugprade creatures
voteText: gold) faster.\nSo essentially there are pay to win elements here. However you can get EVERYTHING without spending a cent
helpfulPercent: you just have to spend more time in the game (like in league of legends or hearthstone).\n"I get too little gold. Developers are forcing me to buy gold."\nI am level 70 and I haven't encountered a single time I've ran out of gold to do matches. How to achieve this? Don't waste all of your gold. Learn the game mechanics
votesHelpful: win. At the moment I win most rounds and I can continiue playing nonstop.\n"Enemy has overpowered legendary creatures. I dont. I cant win."\nAll towns are easily unlockable. Many towns unlock strong creatures. Use them. Use gold to buy creatures. You also get ingame keys within battles
votesTotal: you get legendary creatures there as well. While legendary creatures are strong
votesFunny:
there are many strong non-legendary creatures.

How to increase gold gain?
Unlock more kingdoms. Complete all quests in kingdoms. Read about ingame tactics. Buy a armor. Join a guild. Optionally you can log in daily. Get better at the game. Win more games.

How to increase soul gain?
Buy a armor. Join a decent guild. Finish all town challanges.

How to get ingame armors?
Join a decent guild. You get gems for upgrading your guild with gold.

How to get op creatures?
Join a decent guild. You get keys for upgrading your guild with gold. Finish all town quests."

reviewText:
After reading numerous reviews, I had to offer mine. First, let me assure you that at level 125, I do exist, since many people think 50 is a magical level where things stop. Cogito ergo sum. Let me also state that, in the beginning, I thought things tough. But the more you play, the more you get items you need to improve yourself and, thus, do better against the NPC’s. To date, I’ve defeated every land and every set of challenges.

The game itself is simple: match gems. The more you match, the better off you are. Your troops gain power based on the color matched, and when fully charged, their power can be used. Defeat the other side’s troops, and you win.
The real strategy comes with combining skills. For example, Gorgotha, blows up seven gems at random, so you could potentially get 7x9 or 64 gems that would probably fully charge the other troops.

But I know what people are saying: But he’s an ultra hard troop to get. Possibly, but there are so many combinations. I’ve fought someone with all basic troops that crushed me.

Another aspect of the game is guilds. Guilds help boost your power, give you gems, keys and other things that make you more powerful.

Recently, treasure maps were added. These are pure profit and increase your wealth across the board.  There is also an arena, where you randomly pick three cards and go to battle.

With so many options, it is easy to increase your overall standing in the game. And all without spending a dime.  Instead of quitting when things hit 50, fight through and take a stand.
You will definitely enjoy it once you do.

reviewText:
Since discovering Gems of War on Steam, it's hands-down become my favorite game to play on mobile devices (and sometimes Steam).

This is an excellent match-3 / rpg combo with lots of depth. It receives regular, substantial updates that have improved the game a great deal. It's also available on ios and android (you can use the same account across multiple devices) and works well on all platforms.

There is a cash shop, but it's very fair. Everything is availble for those willing to grind for it, which is made much easier by being involved in an active guild.

Perfect for anyone who enjoys match-3 games.

reviewText: People whining about AI cheating are only sore losers and probably not very good at match 3 games. I got to level 50 with under 5 loss. Gold is easy enough to make if you do pvp" wich isn't real pvp. You match up against other players "deck" so it's pretty relax. Just level up your cards with souls and take time before you play your turn to make sure you don't give easy skulls or "match 4" to your opponent. Overall free to play model is good. a little hard at first but with the daily bonuses and your kingdoms income it gets better fast. Very good game for anyone who played puzzle quest or likes match 3 games."
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText: If you have spent countless hours in Candy Crush, you'll probably like this.  If you also get into RPG's and CCG's then you will love it for sure.  It is very playable on the F2P level, but of course things do not move nearly as fast that way.  Souls (skill raising currency) are not quite but almost finite in F2P.  Armor and such gives you decent buffs to gain bonus Souls, XP's and Gold.  If you're F2P you probably want to join a guild, save up gems and buy armor that gives you a soul boost.  Leveling slow is not a bad thing in F2P.  P2P makes life easier, but the challenge of F2P makes it more fun, IMHO.  I rate it 7.5/10, maybe even a full 8.\n\nBTW- As some other people have mentioned the AI does seem to cheat pretty bad sometimes.  Sometimes the AI will get like 5 or 6 turns in a row with some incredible drops, things that rarely happen for players.  I guess it may just be their way of making up for AI shortcomings, but it pisses you off sometimes.

reviewText: This game mixes the pokemon collect and level up with the matching to create one game that never gets boring. This game has PVP, you can join guilds with your friends, and you can even do challenges and quests to continue the story. You dont have a 5 hour long tutorial, you have 10 minutes of it and then you can enter the world of Gems Of War. You do what you would do in a game like pokemon and find the team with a victory gurantee, as well as make gold, earn glory, and contribute tasks for all your friends. You can even take this game on the go with the mobile version, and of course link your accounts so that you never lose that 7 day daily bonus. You can rank up in PVP and go up unlimited levels. All and all, this game is definitely one of the best I have ever played.

reviewText:
Bejewelled meets Wizard. They have a tactical team vs team game based around collecting cards and careful gameplay.

Pro's:
+ Basic mechanics of completing gem colours to obtain powers are pleasant.
+ Team assembly and basic tactics are easy to learn.

Con's:
- Many powers are extremely imbalanced and feel like you're getting stomped.
- Difficulty takes a huge upswing without giving players enough ability to gain strong enough teams to deal with it.
- The only means of endless grinding costs a large amount of in-game currency, requires completing a difficult questline and provides insufficient reward for difficulty.
- Upgrading various aspects of cards require way too many resources.
- All combat and rewards decided by RNG, often leads to sh*t loot and the enemy AI consistently getting extra turns and power attacks.
- Minor con: NPCs talk way too much.


Starts out as a fun and engaging game, then it makes you pick up the soap.
Much of the game needs a big nerf. Only play this if you like Dark Souls.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is my very first review on Steam.

The game is geared for paying players.

I only played the single player game, I'm not interested in pvp.

As a casual player you don't stand a chance. I couldn't even complete the first quest completely. My cheap units vs strong ai units (pay to win!). It was fun for a while, but then when you're nearing the end of the first quest all the enemy units seem overpowered compared to your weak units (regardless of team/color setup).

Your troops start off as white cards, then green, blue purple and pink is all I've seen. Yeah the game is really fair, my white and maybe green cards vs all the colors above in various combinations (oh that's right, I forgot it's pay to win, play for free only goes so far...). Even the ai white cards present a serious problem. You know there is something wrong when you're still trying to get enough mana for an ability, however the ai has already wiped out 3 of your 4 units.

I tried the other two (close) kingdoms, the first part of each quest I was able to beat (barely) and that was it. Exps and gold are slow to come by, so you must grind, replaying the same losing battle over and over. After a while this just gets boring.

I got the impression that the hint system is more helpful to the ai's next move. It will suggest moves (when there are multiple moves) that will help the ai's next move much more. And the ai never misses anything. And the funny thing is it will suggest matches for colors you have no use for (but if you look ahead you'll see why it's suggesting that particular move). Also noticed that when there are no more moves and it reshuffles fresh for the ai every time. Never once in my short game time did it reshuffle at the end of the ai's move. So don't tell me the gem drops are random.

Supposedly your supposed to be able to collect taxes from your kingdoms (every hour plus whatever is your daily amount). What a crock of poop. All I ever get is 32 gold next day of play. I've unlocked 2 cities, the next one will cost 1000gp to unlock, to get that I'll either need to log in every day for 32 days or win/lose 40 +/- battles or some combination of the two. Perhaps you could make your game more clear with this? What I see when I click income is gold per day (590) +35. And yet next day of game play I get 32 and that's it, plus the usual 17-25 per battle.

The only difference between winning and losing a battle is you get a traitstone, otherwise it's 3-5 exps (souls in the game) and 25 gold max. It's 10 exps to get a troop to level 2, 25 to 3, then 75 to 4 (good luck), talk about a very grindy game.

There's no random encounters, all battles are quest pre-determined. So you must constantly fight the same groups over and over......

You'll get a couple hours of fun, get bored, and then delete the game (or pay to play and enjoy it).

reviewText: Short version: Yes, I recommend this game.\n\nLong version: Yes, I recommend this game; however, it is not the type of game you can sit and play for hours without a break because you will eventually run out of gold (unless, of course, you pay for it or you're a very high level. But, if you're a high level, then you've already sat around and waited for gold to replenish, so you've dealth with this issue as well). In a way, this game reminds me of a fantasy-style Bejeweled but with a storyline. Many of the characters are witty and I found myself looking forward to playing for an hour or two everyday. Every now and then, one of the levels seems extremely difficult and it takes a few tries, but that sense of determination always kept me going. After a while, it gets repetitve (hense why I haven't played much lately). But, it's still a fun game and I think it's a good game to have for when you don't have the time to play something more indepth. I will caution, though, it can be a tempting pay-to-win. Or, in this case, pay-to-have-cards-that-don't-suck-so-I-can-actually-win-this-stupid-level.

reviewText:
I've played this for a Very long time (couple hundred hours?) and I love how the randomness really can turn a battle around for good or bad. It isn't always about having the strongest creatures (common, rare, ultra rare, epic, legendary) in order to win. You can actually earn most of the Epics through the story line, and the arena (opened after the first story area) has been greatly improved to be more useful to those that can win through with the random creatures you choose. I think that the balance is actually quite impressive. The more powerful the creature/weapon? (type not level) The more gems you have to match to use its ability. Conversely, the weaker ones are faster, needing less. Your Hero gains weapons from leveling masteries. You get 1 mastery point per level, and have to choose from the two colors (out of 6 in game) that it gives you.

It really is a great game, and you can get creatures from playing, and spending gold (in game currency) And, you can actually earn pay money slowly, in or out of a guild. You can accumulate it faster in a guild (good for bonuses) and even cheaply Start your own guild if you so choose. Unfortunately, there is no way to tell if a guild is active until you join...

Overall, a Fun game that while it Can be played quickly, just might suck you in for hours at a time...be careful.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I've been with this game for a good while and my hour count can show. I've been on just about every evening, so here's my honest review. Recommended for a casual 5min-10min play. Any longer and you get bored.

Pros
+Simple to play and understand
+Art is decent to nice

Cons
-Gets boring rather fast
-Not much to do
-Based on luck, not skill

My rating: 6/10

Here's why. So, when you begin you can get swept away by the simple gameplay, sharp colors, and nice looking art. Though it doesn't keep it's apeal for long. After a few hours you start getting the sense there isn't much to do, and there isn't. During my first few kingdoms I did read the story and they were okay. But after you complete your first four, the story just seems rather boring. Each kingdom is their own story so there's no real connection between all of them. There's no arc.

The gameplay is all LUCK! Sure, some skill is needed to spot the 4, 5, or 6 piece combos, but the rest is purely on luck. I can't explain how many times I get close to beating a match only to have the computer complete a 6-stage combo and kill all but one of my characters. HELL, even the 'suggestions' the game offers backfires on you and supports the computer instead. So you're constantly debating whether or not to make a move because it's easy to give the computer the upper hand. At the same time it feels AMAZING when you pull of that 7-hit combo.

You don't have to pay for anything. You can get pretty far for free and get decent cards based on whatever luck gives you. You can get the rarest cards through Magic Keys, but there's a rare chance you can get them in the story or tribute. Though you can get the second best cards by completing the stories so it's all good.

You'll literally run out of things to do really quick. I'm at lvl 40+ and I feel bored doing the same thing over and over again. No wonder hardly anyone gets the 50+ Achievement. It just feels like a grind.

reviewText:
The game is addictive, you have a farmville like time waiting system.
You conquer towns by just purshacing them. Purshaced towns giving you a total of moderate amount gold per day. And to do quests, matches, you need to use at least 50 golds per match (it gets higher /+10 per town you conquer.
About the gameplay, it's simply Bejeweld. Furthermore, there is a ranked system which you can buy some good stuff with your ranked points.

But other than that, the game is absolutely involves pay2win factor and the RNG system sadly. You can get to unlock every town with paying real money, so means higher gold you gain per day, this leads opening card packs (which is 1000 gold). Also, there is a real money pack too which gives you a bit stronger cards compared to others. But notice that to unlock a town you also need your account to level up.

Overall, it would be stupid to blame the RNG system since here's nothing can be done about it but wish it was not that much of a limited game for non-paid users. If you are a rager type for unfair situations, I wouldn't recommend this game, otherwise, just get it, it's fun.

reviewText:
This is a pretty fun game which reminds me a lot about another great game called 'Puzzle Quest' of which i played and replayed so much i even lost count~ xP
I've seem many bad(and unfair) reviews about this game so i decided to review it in hopes of getting more people to play it and hopefully also have a lot of fun just like me~ :3

This is a free game,so obviously the dev/devs added stuff you can buy with real money,which if you aren't a completionist(is that a real word?),then it is no problem since if you are always a step ahead,be patient,hope for the best and enjoy the challenges,you can and you will win against all odds.

Many complain about the AI cheating,maybe they were unlucky or maybe they played badly and decided to put the blame on the AI cheating,whatever the case,in most,if not all the games in the world the AIs will always cheat,if they didn't it wouldn't be fun for us players,there would be no challenge and nothing to make us want to play,win and replay again with different tactics.

EDIT: It seems that many people also either don't know how to play and blame it on the it's pay-to-win!" and review it negatively or as i said before "maybe" they are simply the unluckiest people to play this kind of game~ :P
I haven't paid anything with real money yet and i am currently on level 50
date: beaten many players who paid for stuff and all done with a little bit of effort and patience.\nAlso for some reason a level 189 managed to attack me(usually the system give us players with max 10 levels of difference to attack)
recommended: with all stats and monster levels on max (15 for now) and i won

reviewText: I do not see why the game is receiving so much hate. Join a guild as soon as you can, but make sure it's an active guild. The benefits you receive from being in a guild are tremendous! Keys, Souls, gold, etc. And I have had no problems with finding Legendary characters... obviously they are harder to come by, but you will win them after completing all the missions in a specific land. Try to keep 1,000 gold in reserve because when you do missions, you will not win enough gold to replenish the gold you spent to do the mission. Also, make sure you log in daily!\n\nThe game is a wonderful take on the match 3 style puzzle and a really fun game to play to pass the time. I wish there was a way that we could have multiple players on the same computer because I share this account with my husband. reviewText:
Another game I must flip recommendation from + to - :-(((((

The game used to be good. And got better. It had ideas and dev resources. Seems it lasted only up to 1.05 update.  Fro there devs evaporated mostly, and the game went stale waiting and waiting and waiting 1.06 that got delayed by months.  And when it arrived it had nothing good. And all improvement requests were ignored. So the game ust went on dying of boredom.

Then a few weeks ago out of the blue we got another update, 1.07. With drastic changes around the boad. And devs promising they are on again.

Unfortunately most of the changes are bad and/or unfair. And while the potential surfaced again, the first few weeks of action clearly shows the direction is HOPELESS.  The design is either out of hand or is deliberately steered to a bad destination.

TLDR: I can't recommend the game any more for either new or old players.

- --- old review with recommended status

EDIT: With 1.0.5 update the game got much much better. We got Arena that is kind-of sealed deck format that keeps up fresh challenge and drops cool prizes too (if you win.)

And kingdoms now have 1-click collect with tributes that provide many resources if you bothered to play the content.

Guilds got minimal communication and is promised improvements soon. In short the game is alive keeps improving in all directions.

- ---
Recommended only IF you are okay with actually well playing AI and losing a plenty. :)

This game finally looks tuned to those who look for actual strategy and challenge, resouces are not abundant so you need careful plan and AI is definitely not forgiving for mistakes -- also you can lose anytime just to RNG snake eyes, but overall can manage using brains in the long run. Especially if you adjust your team and play depending on the opponents.

PVP probably could be better if you had some intel option to have a clue about the opponent and could deploy a better matching team, but well, more the challenge here.

To be effective you should concentrate your effort: playing a full quest line for a town gives you the hero providing the quests (usually a really stromg card), and completing the last challenge star gives 100 souls to add several levels to your fighters. Levels mean huge improvements obviously.

The guild stuff lacks communication that makes in not really interesting unless you organize one from people you know already.

reviewText: Alright, so if your quick to anger or easily angered like I am, or want to feel/like being the person who wins in games, I do not recommend this game at all. reviewText:
First of all: this game doesn't deserve all the negative reviews. It's a very intriguing mix between a basic match-3 combo game and a card game, where you create your own team.

I want to highlight what I like about Gems of War:

Lots of different units with unique spells and attack moves make for endless team constellations that you can try out.
You don't to spend real money at all. Simply because you don't need the cash items to enjoy the game and moreover there is a way to get small amounts of cash currency in the game, so you can save up.
The unit design is beautiful. All kinds of fantasy creatures and heroes - check it out.
There are many things to do and you can create a guild with your friends and work on goals together.
It's very good if you only have small time windows for some casual playing - you can easily play 1-2 rounds and make progress in 10-15 minutes without having to invest hours at once.
The new update brought plenty of new features including harder difficulties for extra challenging gameplay.
Big fat recommendation!
10/10

reviewText:
Everyone said that this game is quite annoying with it's coins spend system for playing or souls spend system to level up your troops. But, here, i'll give my opinion, but seriously, no offense.

First, everyone said that if you want to play more, you'll need coins more. It means that when your coin is running low, you can't play it. But if you invade the other players and win, you can get more coins to play. It's true that you can't play it for hours or more because the coin system, but that is the art of this game, patient.

Second, to level up your troops, you need souls. Everytime you win a match, you'll get 4 souls. The amount of souls you need to level up your cards increases by large amounts as you level up the cards. But you can get souls from challange and disenchant your troops.

This game it's hard when you play in in first day or week, but you can enjoy it and keep playing if you get max daily bonus coins, join a guild, and invade other players. If you join a guild, you can get keys, souls, even diamonds for every task completed. Try to level up to about level 50 or more, and you can join a good guild to help you. And the most important things is patient and skill. If you got enough diamonds from guild tasks, try to get costume that increases your coins or souls everytime you play games.

I never pay for this game but i have no problems with the coins and souls. Except for the server problems.

Enjoy~

reviewText:
First, I'd like to say I Loved Puzzle Quest One  and Two; Those two games  ate up a large quantity of my life.
That being said, I was still wary approaching Gems of War.

I had read most of the negative reviews, and in the end decided to take the (free) plunge and decide what I truly thought of the game.

As soon as I started playing it, I loved it. It was puzzle quest all over again, with tweaked mechanincs, new card/troop systems and a whole lot more content than we saw in the  previous games.
The game plays great, carried by it's solid, dependeable, if it aint broke dont change it" gem matching gameplay. There's far more strategy this time around in the form of collectible cards called "troops" which differ in rarity.
Trying to wrangle more of these cards just added to the obsessive-addictive depth the developers put into the game.

The problem is

reviewText:
I don't understand how people complain about running out of gold, I have this on my iPhone and on my laptop and I always have a plethora of gold to battle. The key is to invade and beat other players, because instead of 25 gold per victory you can get upwards of 300 or so gold. Plus the more kingdoms you buy the more gold you get per day. Plus if you have a great selection of kingdoms sometimes you'll possibly get offerings of gems, keys, and souls.

This game equips you of everything you need to continue playing, you just have to budget a little at the beginning. On my iPhone version I have over 30,000 gold and I can drop gold on keys as I please. On this version I have about 10,000.

So, I do love this game, and I HIGHLY recommend it. it's a great way to pass time.

reviewText: Yes, Gems of War can be a pain to play if you dive in for hours at a time and expect Puzzle Quest-like addictiveness without paying a cent. The game does deliver the gameplay goods. But it's clearly a child of the modern F2P" era where that "f" stands for "free"
date: but some players will be thinking of other words that begin with that letter when they try to play in longer stretches and can't unless they dip into their wallets.\n\nGranted
recommended: the industry's current "free" model is  broken in the first place because it's taught gamers to devalue the work of people who make these games (some of which can be good and worth paying for without the paywall nonsense). Conversely
hoursPlayed: many game studios seem to be trapped in the model because they rely on people buying into the idea of timed pay as if they're remaking the arcade experience into a more sinister version. Well
voteText: these aren't at all the same as arcade games for a few key reasons I won't get into here.\n\nThat said
helpfulPercent: when Gems works
votesHelpful: it works quite well. The mechanics are solid and the game doesn't "cheat" as some say because you can get some pretty wild Extra Turn and Mana Surge runs yourself. This is particularly true if you're good at reading the board and not making "suggested moves" or matches before considering every gem's place post move.\n\nOf course
votesTotal:
sometimes you do just get "lucky". I just completed a game where the AI had a nice streak that ended when the board had no more matches and my turn came as the board shifted with a 5-skull drop and me grinning like a crazed squirrel that just discovered an overturned peanut truck. That led to a run where two of my cards were able to get in nice extra turn runs that wiped out the enemy. "Luck" goes both ways in these games. You just need to roll with the punches and perhaps think of logging out for the day if you're having a bad run. The game will be there tomorrow.

Want to enjoy this game more? Quit playing for long periods of time and game the system a bit so it's paying YOU to play it.

As I don't always have an active internet connection AND a busy life outside of one game
votesFunny: I'm not able to play this for hours on end like some who dislkie those annoying paywalls. So
commentsCount: I (somewhat accidentally) came up with a way to enjoy this at my own pace:\n\n1. After an incident where I logged in
column16: collected a gold bonus and my connection dropped out (boo!)
column17: I had the realization that the game pays you in-game gold that you can hoard as long as you don't use it every day.  So
column18: I try to log in daily to collect the gold and kingdom rewards and don't touch the main game for a week or so unless I have time for a few matches. At some point
column19: without playing much (I'm level 16 as I type this) and just from collecting gold bonuses
column20: I had close to 30K stocked up
column21: which was good for unlocking kingdoms and buying keys to unlock better characters.\n\n2. When I do have time to play
column22: I put in about 15-20 minutes then STOP for the day. Period. I have other stuff to do
column23: so I don't obsess over not getting through events or getting certain rare stuff. My one concession was picking up a rare weapon I had my eye on because of its effects that made getting through a certain boss fight really easy.\n\n3. I'm not a PvP guy
column24: so I avoid it. I've been invaded and have had to defend a few times
column25: but I don't sweat it because it's always been a much stronger enemy I lose to. But I don't sweat it because it's only a small bit of gold and I can get that back by not playing for a day or so.\n\nOther than that
column26: I like much of what Gems does on the game front and not much on the monetization front. That $4.99 one time offer pop-up is super tempting (and probably recommended to total newbies or those who want to pay something)
column27: but I prefer to play this completely for free as long as it's fun for me. It's too bad that it's NOT offline at all and the pay model is a bit too eager to attempt to get players to whip out that credit card. At the end of the day
column28: this is a game I think would work better as a standalone retail product or digital download where you pay once and play at your leisure."

reviewText:
NOT A PAY TO WIN - Only a random chance to get good cards, you can not pay anything and get mostly the same experience
Game is fun initially, when you level up fast, get more new and interesting cards it is exciting. Then about 20hrs in you will find the cards you like and unless a legendary comes along, you will stick with the same party for a long time.

Gets grindy and a little dull after a while when you get no new cards and stick with the same team for a long time, The amount of resource used to level up your cards is too damn high so if you want to try out a new team it is hard to judge unless you want to waste this resource

ALL the battles are AI controlled. Even the 'Invade' battles where the AI takes control of another players party. I have wone multiple 'PVP' games against teams filled with 'broken' cards. Because of the AI controled battles and the randomness of the gem drops this game is not pay to win.

All in all the game is fun enough and you will get a kick out of it for the first 20 hrs for free. After that decide if you want to sink $10 or so into it to get more gold or chests for cards

reviewText:
Possibly the cheapest game ive ever seen. I love playing it while I can, but here's a tip for newbies:
Never follow the hints on the puzzle board unless you are 100% sure that it isnt setting up a combo for the computer because 99 out of 100 times if you click what it hints to you you will get screwed.
Also, the amount of gold that it takes to play a match is so rediculously high that youll never play the game more than 2 hours, and most of the time no longer than a half hour if you spent any gold on getting packs or unlocking more storyline that day. Also, the matchmaking in PvP is downright awful. The only reason I PvP is for the glory points. Half the time I wonder if they are even worth it because the rewards are pretty awful except for the most expensive one. Also, a question to the developers who for some reason love to cheat players out of gold: Why would an opponent click a combo of four when they dont gain gold and they arent gaining mana from it or cheating you out of mana (a viable tactic), but the computer always will and itll cheat you every chance it gets even if there is a match where it wouldve gained mana or cheated it from you. I understand that devs need to make money but blatantly cheating people out of ingame currency says a lot about the ethics of the people who made the AI in this game.
Again, it's fun to play while you play it but dont expect much playtime unless you want to drop your bank account into it.

reviewText:
editing my review. i like the game now. its very casual and allthough it takes a few days to get going i dont mind it. its something i can look forward to each day, comming back for that daily 1k gold from the event and home kingdom. then useing that 1k to buy a key and seeing what cards you get. after a few weeks my troops have gotten nice from disenchanting the extras and boosting the ones i use with them possible good enough i have finishing challenges ( i have close to 8 finished at the moment) and after finishing each challenge the games starting to become easier to bare (like the AI getting 4-4 in the row combos)

what doesnt change in my review is that its pay to win ( u can buy better keys to get better cards thus disenchanting the better ones for more souls to level up your troops)

BUT if your casual. you can also enjoy this game. just not as fast as those who pay.
if you do plan to try this game out. give this game at least 3 weeks. and i mean 3 weeks straight. dont skip a day. 20mins a day for this game is fine.

reviewText:
This a Great game, really. It not easy to play. I must admit you need lots of luck to play this. Talk about the gold, if you play everyday upto 7 days you can earn up to 750+ gold more, try to win some PvP game, it does cost 50~80 gold per match but you can earn back 30~50 gold per match (50 gold per match is a badass enemy). My advice? Don't buy keys, you can earn them just by matching those gems.

Defend you kingdom does gain gold, it cost you 50 gold to get around 30~60 gold, easy money. By the way you can get EPIC cards , i repeat EPIC CARDS just by unlock the kingdom and finish all it quest. By finish all the challenge you can earn 100 souls, enough to upgrade the hell out og your troop up to max Level.
Thsoe challenge are nothing, it super easy.

For those who said this game not good, I feel sad for them. It a good game for great mind. Just don't play it when you have a bad day. You might fall in a losing chain instead of winning chain. It like playing chess, you move one gem wrong , you dead.

After 45 hours of playing I now have a great deck without paying any real money. Totaly a free game, only those who want to be OP fast in this game, pay their money :v

reviewText:
I really like this game.
The puzzling is addictive and the different units you encounter give every battle its own unique flavor

I see two common complaints about this game:
1- You have to pay real money to win. This is NOT true. You can easily get a good unit from the free key drops and if you think about how to put your best line-up out there you can definately beat someone with 3 legendary troops. I spent a lot of time just winning P2P with a common troop (goblin) in my line-up.
2- You can only play 10 minutes a day because you run out of gold to pay for your battles. Also NOT true. Just win some matches at P2P and gain enough gold to keep playing for as long as you'd llike.

Highly reccommended game, IMHO.

recommended: hell I've considered uninstalling.\n\nYes I still recommend playing this for a few hours and the decent format of the game. There is just some hidden numbers that don't truly make the game fair to play."

reviewText:
To be honest,I love puzzle games that require such strategy.But what do I think of the game?
Well,lets list out what makes the game good.
-There are variations in troops and banners,meaning you can plan a strategy that may work with mixed or non-mixed troops.
-The game gives some challenge where challenge is due.
-With limited gold,it can addict you when you soon get cut off and have to wait.
That's in the positive for me.But...as for the negatives...
-The difficulty curve is far too steep,even for me.
-The AI works too smart even when your ability level is way below the curve.

When it comes down to things,I'd much prefer Puzzle Quest over Gems of War,despite how addiction draws me back to this difficult,free game.Would I recommend this game?If you're much more skilled than I am,I'd definitely recommend it.Otherwise,don't waste your time and go get Puzzle Quest instead.

reviewText: I wish there was a third.. meh" option. Overall I'd say its a good game
date: especially given that it's free. I play a bit every day and it keeps me occupied
recommended:
but I have some gripes that I need to air out here.

1) It's pay to win. Bleh.

2) It really really needs better AI. Right now the AI is pretty dumb and easily exploitable. This is the formula:

If 5 match then take it
else if 4 match then take it
else if 3 skulls match then take it
else if attack skill ready then use it
else match 3 of a useable color then take it
else match 3 of an unuseable color

3) The AI gets a major handicap in the form of free moves. Because the AI is so dumb
hoursPlayed: the AI opponent is given numerous extra moves in the form of predetermined matches that fall after the player moves. This results in the computer more often than not getting 3-4 turns for every one of the player. Sometimes these extra moves
voteText: rather than being a result of a 4 or 5 match
helpfulPercent: are simply given to the AI at random. While this certainly boosts the difficulty
votesHelpful: I would much rather just have a smarter AI than a cheating one. Many of the matches become ridiculously one-sided after the first move by the player
votesTotal: which rather than being a fun challenge
votesFunny:
is just a bore at that point.

I wish the devs would have taken all the time they used to compensate for the AI and put it into improving the AI.

That's really my main gripe. The gold limit on playtime has yet to actually bother me
commentsCount: given that this isn't the sort of game you sit down and play for hours on end. Heaven help you if you do."
